sect1.title: Setup Cloud Storage Service
sect1.para: &productcloud; provides cloud-based services for storage of dive logs created in &productdesktop; and &productmobile; when these editions are configured to use &productcloud; services. In doing so &productcloud; is able to facilitate not only the storage of dive logs on the cloud but also serves as a means to exchange divelogs between editions.
The setup of either edition is easy, quick to do and secure. All you need is an email address and the ability to access your email inbox during the setup process.

orderedlist.title: To create a cloud storage account:

listitem.para: From the Main Menu, select File Preferences .
The Preferences dialog is displayed.
Select the Network options group.
Enter your email address in the Email address field.
Enter a password in the Password field.
Click the Apply button.
After a second or two a message will be displayed at the bottom of the screen.
listitem.screen: Cloud account verification required, enter PIN in preferences.

listitem.para: Check your email inbox for a an email from "do_not_reply__@subsurface-divelog.org" with subject "Subsurface Cloud Account PIN".
This message will contain the PIN number you require in order to verify your &productcloud; account.
Enter the PIN to the Verification PIN field, then click the Apply button.
If the verification task is successful the options group lable will display the works "(credentials verified)".

important.para: Congratulations you have sucessfully created your &productcloud; account. Remember to write down the email address and password used so that you can recall it in the event that you should forget.

orderedlist.title: To change you cloud storage account password:

listitem.para: From the Main Menu, select File Preferences .
The Preferences dialog is displayed.
Select the Network options group.
Enter a password in the New password field.
Click the Save button.
Select File Open cloud storage to check that you still have access to the cloud storage.

note.para: When changing password the current correct password must be entered to thePassword field.

warning.para: At time of writing there is no way for a user to reset a &productcloud; account password without manual intervention from one of the developers.
Please remember your email and password authentication combination, even write it down somewhere.
In the event that you did not heed this warning, please read this thread on the user forum.

sect1.title: Setup Support for Video Thumbnails
sect1.para: &product; provides support for associating videos taken during a dive with a dive log. When a video is associated with a dive log, &productshort; will display the video in the &paneldiveprofile; panel or in the &paneldiveinfo; panel Media tab. To make this possible &productshort; needs to generate and display a video thumbnail from the associated video.
By default the video thumbnail is a nonspecific placeholder. To see thumbnails that represent individual videos, &productshort; uses an external program called FFMPEG.

orderedlist.title: To enable thumbnails for videos you need to:

listitem.para: Download FFMPEG.
Install FFMPEG
Enable Extract video thumnails.
Put the ffmpeg.exe file in the directory containing the &productshort; executable.
Ensure sure the ffmpeg command is in the environment path. This should be the case when installed from official packages.
From the Main Menu select File Preferences .
The Preferences is displayed.
Select the General options group.
Under Video thumbnails check the Extract video thumbnails checkbox.
Click the Save to store these settings.
Select a record from the &paneldivelist; that has a video associated with it.
Inspect the &paneldiveprofile; panel and &paneldiveinfo; panel Media tab to verify that the settings are working.

note.para: If &productshort; fails to load the FFMPEG executable, the Extract video thumbnails checkbox will be unchecked. After successfully installing FFMPEG check the checkbox to re-enable Extract video thumbnails.
